title: rest client can`t establish connection in native mode when you use virtual thread
body:
### Describe the bug I found thatï¼š
if you use restClient in this way ```java @Inject @RestClient ApiService apiService; private final ExecutorService executorService = Executors.newVirtualThreadPerTaskExecutor(); private void executeWithVirtualThread(){ executorService.execute(()->apiService.sendHello()); } ``` rest client can`t connect to target http server and there is no log like that in terminal ```shell DEBUG [org.apa.htt.imp.con.DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator] (executor-thread-0) Connection established 192.168.123.73:55777<->192.168.123.73:5700 ``` but if you use rest client whitout virtual thread , everything is worked the same issue also exists in StructuredTaskScope ### Expected behavior in native mode , rest client should establish connection when you use virtual thread ### Actual behavior rest client establishes connection failed ### How to Reproduce? _No response_ ### Output of `uname -a` or `ver` Darwin AlexdeAir.lan 21.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.6.0: Thu Sep 29 20:12:57 PDT 2022; root:xnu-8020.240.7~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64 ### Output of `java -version` ```shell openjdk version "19.0.1" 2022-10-18 OpenJDK Runtime Environment GraalVM CE 22.3.0 (build 19.0.1+10-jvmci-22.3-b08) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM GraalVM CE 22.3.0 (build 19.0.1+10-jvmci-22.3-b08, mixed mode, sharing) ``` ### GraalVM version (if different from Java) _No response_ ### Quarkus version or git rev 2.15.0.Final ### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`) Apache Maven 3.8.6 ### Additional information _No response_
